sn36.6:1.1: “Mendicants, an uneducated ordinary person feels pleasant, painful, and neutral feelings.
sn36.6:1.2: An educated noble disciple also feels pleasant, painful, and neutral feelings.
sn36.6:1.3: What, then, is the difference between an ordinary uneducated person and an educated noble disciple?”
sn36.6:1.4: “Our teachings are rooted in the Buddha. …”
sn36.6:1.5: “When an uneducated ordinary person experiences painful physical feelings they sorrow and wail and lament, beating their breast and falling into confusion.
sn36.6:1.8: It’s like a person who is struck with an arrow,
sn36.6:1.9: only to be struck with a second arrow.
sn36.6:1.10: That person experiences the feeling of two arrows.
sn36.6:1.11: In the same way, when an uneducated ordinary person experiences painful physical feelings they sorrow and wail and lament, beating their breast and falling into confusion.
sn36.6:1.14: When they’re touched by painful feeling, they resist it.
sn36.6:1.15: The underlying tendency for repulsion towards painful feeling underlies that.
sn36.6:1.16: When touched by painful feeling they look forward to enjoying sensual pleasures.
sn36.6:1.18: Because an uneducated ordinary person doesn’t understand any escape from painful feeling apart from sensual pleasures.
sn36.6:1.19: Since they look forward to enjoying sensual pleasures, the underlying tendency to greed for pleasant feeling underlies that.
sn36.6:1.20: They don’t truly understand feelings’ origin, ending, gratification, drawback, and escape.
sn36.6:1.21: The underlying tendency to ignorance about neutral feeling underlies that.
sn36.6:1.22: If they feel a pleasant feeling, they feel it attached.
sn36.6:1.23: If they feel a painful feeling, they feel it attached.
sn36.6:1.24: If they feel a neutral feeling, they feel it attached.
sn36.6:1.25: They’re called an uneducated ordinary person who is attached to rebirth, old age, and death, to sorrow, lamentation, pain, sadness, and distress, I say.
sn36.6:2.1: When an educated noble disciple experiences painful physical feelings they don’t sorrow or wail or lament, beating their breast and falling into confusion.
sn36.6:3.1: It’s like a person who is struck with an arrow,
sn36.6:3.2: but was not struck with a second arrow.
sn36.6:3.3: That person would experience the feeling of one arrow.
sn36.6:3.4: In the same way, when an educated noble disciple experiences painful physical feelings they don’t sorrow or wail or lament, beating their breast and falling into confusion.
sn36.6:3.7: When they’re touched by painful feeling, they don’t resist it.
sn36.6:3.8: There’s no underlying tendency for repulsion towards painful feeling underlying that.
sn36.6:3.9: When touched by painful feeling they don’t look forward to enjoying sensual pleasures.
sn36.6:3.11: Because an educated noble disciple understands an escape from painful feeling apart from sensual pleasures.
sn36.6:3.12: Since they don’t look forward to enjoying sensual pleasures, there’s no underlying tendency to greed for pleasant feeling underlying that.
sn36.6:3.13: They truly understand feelings’ origin, ending, gratification, drawback, and escape.
sn36.6:3.14: There’s no underlying tendency to ignorance about neutral feeling underlying that.
sn36.6:3.15: If they feel a pleasant feeling, they feel it detached.
sn36.6:3.16: If they feel a painful feeling, they feel it detached.
sn36.6:3.17: If they feel a neutral feeling, they feel it detached.
sn36.6:3.18: They’re called an educated noble disciple who is detached from rebirth, old age, and death, from sorrow, lamentation, pain, sadness, and distress, I say.
sn36.6:3.19: This is the difference between an educated noble disciple and an uneducated ordinary person.
sn36.6:4.1: A wise and learned person isn’t affected
sn36.6:4.2: by feelings of pleasure and pain.
sn36.6:4.3: This is the great difference in skill
sn36.6:4.4: between the wise and the ordinary.
sn36.6:5.1: A learned person who has assessed the teaching
sn36.6:5.2: discerns this world and the next.
sn36.6:5.3: Desirable things don’t disturb their mind,
sn36.6:5.4: nor are they repelled by the undesirable.
sn36.6:6.2: are cleared and ended, they are no more.
sn36.6:6.4: they who have gone beyond rebirth understand rightly.”
